page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The land rises as you enter the area from Chelmsford but then it is mainly flat.It is an agricultural place with lots of farms.The fields have crops in them,sometimes cows & horses.There are woods,one of them has been turned into a nature reserve. The area has a post office,three garages,a chapel,four pubs one of which is said to be haunted ,a butcher, a farm shop,a take-away cafe. At the village hall various activities take place & the playing field alongside is used for football & cricket as well as a children's play area.During the middle of June the main road from Chelmsford to Braintree is blocked with traffic going to the Essex Show Ground.The old houses are dotted about the village with two new Estates and a council Estate grouped together.
